WHY DO I BELIEVE THAT THIS CURRENT BULL CYCLE IS A ‚ÄúLENGTHENING CYCLE.‚Äù ?

‚û°Ô∏è Spot Bitcoin ETFs brought massive billions of net inflow‚Äîwith big companies massive adoption globally.

‚û°Ô∏è The pro-crypto U.S. stance under Trump with the Strategic Bitcoin Reserve proposal (1M BTC over 5 years) signals long-term support.

‚û°Ô∏è No retail mania yet‚Äîa key sign we haven't hit cycle peak while Bitcoin dominance is ~65% and altcoins are lagging.

‚û°Ô∏è Expected Fed rate cuts and easing inflation in 2025 with a weakening USD, rising global M2, and QT slowdown = bullish setup.

We are entering into institutional maturity, which suggests that the current crypto market cap is undervalued at $3.4 trillion

lol
What‚Äôs the point of a debt ceiling if we keep raising it?

Trump, or a member of his administration, is now attacking/criticizing Powell at least once a day. They are not going to tire of this and stop. The only way this backs off is if inflation rears its head.

From the Fed's perspective, this is a lose-lose. Either Trump attacks will get louder, or inflation returns, and the Fed will get blamed and skewered by everyone.

A strict reading of this post in the last 30 minutes suggests Trump thinks the funds rate should now be between 0.00% and 0.50% ("should be here").

And he is not letting this go. 

Is he trying to force a July rate cut?

The market is still pricing a 19% probability of a cut.

On the flipside, if Waller or Bowman do try to "blow up" the FOMC with dissents and directed criticism at their colleagues (including Powell) for not cutting rates on July 30, it will put them in a position to actually become Powell's successor.

So, there is an incentive to blowing up the FOMC, as it might work in getting the Fed Chair job next year.

Yesterday, Trump said:

"Then we‚Äôre gonna get somebody into the Fed who‚Äôs going to be able to lower [the rates]," Trump said, noting the rates should be at 1 or 2%. "You know, if you look at Switzerland, they‚Äôre the lowest right now. They‚Äôre at much less than one point, and frankly, we should be there, too
---
Trump thinks the current 4.25% - 4.5% funds rate should NOW be below 1%. He does not care that the market is assigning a 19% probability of a rate cut on July 30, or an 81% probability of no move (chart). 

Trump thinks this is an egregious mistake, which is why he called  Powell a "very stupid person" yesterday as well.

So, unless Waller or Bowman goes full "to the wall" for a rate cut on July 30, they are out as a successor to Powell.

How far are they willing to go to get in the good graces of Trump for this promotion?

The betting market has current Fed Governor Chris Waller solidly in the mix at 17% (green).

On Friday, Trump said he will not consider anyone for Fed chair who supports holding rates where they are. 

So Waller and Bowman have a choice ... go to the wall for a rate cut in July, meaning dissent and criticize your colleagues for not cutting, or be removed from the list of those under consideration.

Interestingly, Bloomberg referred to it as 'Trump,' not the United States, on Friday.

*TRUMP ENDS TRADE TALKS WITH CANADA, CITING DIGITAL SERVICE TAX

But tonight it was Canada, and not Mark Carney, that caved (above).

CACO = Canada Always Chickens Out

In the last hour ...

*CANADA RESCINDS DIGITAL SERVICES TAX TO ADVANCE US TRADE TALKS

*CANADA SAYS TO RESUME US TRADE TALKS, TARGET DEAL BY JULY 21
He learned a valuable lesson ... he lost because he did not promise enough free stuff.
Apparently it was not Jamie Dimon as I thought in a previous post

And today there was a surge for Bessent (cyan) ... he took over the lead to replace Powell.

Could he be BOTH Treasury Secretary and Fed Chairman?

Now, suggesting US rates should be less than 1%, still on track for Trump to call for negative rates sometime in July.

Trump this morning ...

"You know, if you look at Switzerland, they‚Äôre the lowest right now. They‚Äôre at much less than one point, and frankly, we should be there, too

So is Bessent going to pile massive borrowing into the T-Bill market? Then Trump will appoint someone who will cut rates, allowing them to refinance at lower rates.

----

Trump this morning ...

Trump said he was going to refinance the $9 trillion as short-term debt because "we have a stupid person" at the Federal Reserve.

The president explained his desire for the Federal Reserve to lower interest rates so the U.S. does not have to pay for 10 years of debt at a higher rate.

"Then we‚Äôre gonna get somebody into the Fed who‚Äôs going to be able to lower [the rates]," Trump said, noting the rates should be at 1 or 2%. "You know, if you look at Switzerland, they‚Äôre the lowest right now. They‚Äôre at much less than one point, and frankly, we should be there, too, because‚Ä¶ without the United States, the whole world doesn‚Äôt work."So is Bessent going to pile massive borrowing into the T-Bill market? Then Trump will appoint someone who will cut rates, allowing them to refinance at lower rates.

OpenAI clarified that it is in early testing with some of Google's $GOOG TPUs, and currently has no plans to deploy the chips at scale, per Reuters.

$NVDA $AMD

Nvidia $NVDA remained the top IC firm globally in Q1, extending its market share by 3 points QoQ to 55% as Blackwell‚Äôs ramp drove revenue higher. 

Qualcomm $QCOM, Broadcom $AVGO and AMD $AMD took second to fourth, accounting for 39% of the market combined.

Accelerating AI revenue is driving a strong acceleration in Semiconductor revenue growth for Broadcom $AVGO, up from 11% in Q1 to a guided 25% in Q3. 
io-fund.com/artificial-intel‚Ä¶

Apple $AAPL is reportedly considering powering a new version of Siri using AI models from Anthropic or OpenAI, instead of its internal AI models, per Bloomberg. 

$MSFT $AMZN

Overall, AI startups accounted for nearly three-fifths of all VC investments in Q1, up from less than 30% in Q3 2024.

$NVDA $MSFT $AMZN $GOOG $CRM

Robinhood $HOOD announced this morning that it is launching tokens in partnership with Arbitrum to allow its EU users to trade over 200 popular US stocks and ETFs, including Nvidia $NVDA, Apple $AAPL, and Microsoft $MSFT.

The EU said that 76 firms have submitted bids to help build AI gigafactories across Europe, a larger response than expected.

EU tech chief Henna Virkkunen said the firms "have now indicated plans to acquire at least 3 million latest generation of AI processors (GPUs) in total."

$NVDA $AMD

Oracle $ORCL CEO Safra Catz:

"Our MultiCloud database revenue continues to grow at over 100%, and we signed multiple large cloud services agreements including one that is expected to contribute more than $30 billion in annual revenue starting in FY28."

$MSFT $GOOG $AMZN

This was led primarily by OpenAI‚Äôs mega $40 billion funding round.
